stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.

stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.

Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM THE OSTERRA AIRWAVES! üéôÔ∏è

Step right up, ladies and gentlemen, ghouls and ghosts! This is your favorite demon of the dial, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the edge of a caravan oasis at the **Sun-Baked Bowl**! ‚òÄÔ∏è We are in the final week of the regular season, folks, and the tension is thicker than a swamp-ogre's neck! Today, we've got a real humdinger as the **Confluence Captains** travel down from their mountain high-rises to face off against the **The Desert Spectres**! 

Now, look at this crowd! Or lack thereof! It seems the Spectres haven't quite captured the hearts of the masses like those Zmeigorod Snessengers, but who cares about popularity when you've got blood in the sand? üèúÔ∏è The heat is absolutely oppressive‚ÄîI can see the sweat boiling off the players already! The Captains are looking fancy, likely funded by that 'kissless virgin' Brennen Farno and his Guild of the Black Sky. I hear they're building a Skyport, but can they build a winning strategy? 

Keep an eye on the pre-game rituals, folks! Over in the Captains' dugout, **Ladew Evelina** just chugged a raw egg‚Äîshell and all! That's the kind of grit I love! Meanwhile, **Belding Chloe** is rubbing the Trollball on her armpits for that 'extra grip.' It's disgusting, it's foul, it's Trollball! On the Spectres' side, **Angelita Darce** is shaving exactly half of his mustache. Why? Because it‚Äôs the playoffs, baby! ü™í Grab your hats and hold onto your souls, because we are about to see some beautiful, unadulterated carnage!
postGame:
# üèÜ FINAL REPORT: CRUNCHING BONES IN THE CANYON! üèÜ

What a display of magnificent mayhem we just witnessed, Osterra! The **Confluence Captains** have secured a 2-0 victory over the **Desert Spectres**, and they did it with the kind of ruthless efficiency that would make my boss, Lord Orzalon, shed a single, oily tear! It was a low-scoring affair, sure, but the medical tent is absolutely overflowing, and isn't that why we all tune in? üèüÔ∏è

Things started off with a real laugh when **Steve** for the Spectres picked up the ball and immediately dropped it like it was a hot coal! You‚Äôd think with a name like Steve, she‚Äôd have more coordination, but that‚Äôs the 'hero' luck for you‚Äîall flash and no finish! üìâ **Ladew Evelina** was quick to capitalize, snatching that troll head up and putting the Captains on the offensive while the Spectres' defense looked like they were trying to tackle shadows in a sandstorm.

The highlight of the first half was undoubtedly **Belding Chloe**. After blocking a desperate tackle from Steve, she stepped back in the Home Field and let it fly! **SWISH!** A 2-point shoot that silenced the dunes! üèÄ She‚Äôs been rubbing that ball in her pits all morning, and clearly, the scent was too much for the Spectres to handle! That gave the Captains a lead they would never relinquish, much to the chagrin of Geth the Gravelord and his desert-dwelling disappointment!

But let's talk about the real action‚Äîthe violence! **Muscolo Jaehne** gave us a thrill by absolutely leveling **Vonni Geoff**, sending him to the infirmary with a sickening crunch! ü¶¥ That‚Äôs what I like to see! The Spectres were playing angry, but the Captains‚Äô defense, led by **Stephan Lisk**, was a brick wall. Lisk even snagged a wild pass from Steve, turning a Spectres drive into a total disaster. The Guild must be proud‚Äîor at least as proud as those money-grubbing priests can be!

At halftime, the healers did their dirty work, dragging the broken bodies back onto the field. **Verlee Dacia** was busy sweetening the Spectres with honeycomb, but it didn't help their aim! **O'Conner Maighdlin** tried to extend the Captains' lead with a shot from center field, but it went wide! It seems rhyming for an hour before the game doesn't actually help your depth perception, who would've guessed? ü§°

The second half turned into a literal hospital ward! **Angelita Darce** came out swinging that bardiche and put **Carnahan Laud** on the ground! üè• Not to be outdone, **Belding Chloe** decided she wasn't done being the MVP and absolutely wrecked **Shelman McQuoid**. The sand was turning a lovely shade of crimson, and I was sitting here with a grin wider than a Cheshire Cat! It‚Äôs just a shame the Haven Lights weren't here to get pummeled too!

The Spectres tried to rally, but their luck was drier than the Great Desert. **Bahr Ethelstan** tried to make a run for it, but the Captains' defense swarmed him like flies on a carcass. Every time the Spectres thought they had an opening, someone like **Caves Cestar** was there to intercept the ball or deliver a punishing blow. It was a masterclass in mountain-grown brutality!

In the closing moments, the carnage reached a fever pitch! **Carnahan Laud**, back from her injury, decided to share the pain and took out **Muscolo Jaehne**! Then, just for good measure, **Ladew Evelina**‚Äîthe egg-chugging queen herself‚Äîtackled **Fidellia Mozelle** so hard her ancestors felt it! üç≥ Three Spectres players were down and out by the final whistle. If this were a popularity contest, the Spectres would be buried, but in a fight, they at least went down swinging!

So, there you have it! **Confluence Captains: 2, Desert Spectres: 0.** The Captains are heading into the playoffs with momentum and a lot of sticky Trollballs! The Spectres are heading home to lick their wounds and maybe teach their dogs some more 'useless tricks' like Eileen Mikihisa. üêï

Don't forget to tune in next week for the playoffs, folks! I‚Äôll be rooting for my beloved **Ebon Gate Corruptors** to tear through the competition like a hot knife through butter! And as for those 'heroes' of the realm? Tell Sir Tanos to keep his Sunbringer away from my radio booth, or he might find out what a real demon tackle feels like! üé§

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the Sun-Baked Bowl! Stay nasty, Osterra! ü§ò
